lobby.initializingText: INITIALIZING STRATEGIC ENGINE... SACRIFICE PROTOCOLS ENGAGED. LOGIC IS COLD. VICTORY REQUIRES LOSS.

log.calculationErrorKo: Calculation error: No valid moves available.

psychology.capturedPiece1: You captured my piece. Expected behavior.
psychology.capturedPiece2: Pursuing material gain. But that's the trap.
psychology.capturedPiece3: You were targeting my piece. Already calculated.
psychology.capturedPiece4: Aggressive choice, but countermeasures are prepared.
psychology.kingForward1: I see your plan to advance the king. That path is blocked.
psychology.kingForward2: A direct path to victory. Expected behavior.
psychology.kingForward3: Your intent to move the king forward is clear. I will block it.
psychology.knightThreat1: You're targeting my piece. Expected behavior.
psychology.knightThreat3: Attempting to threaten with the knight. Futile.
psychology.pawnDefensive1: Defensive positioning. But that's the trap.
psychology.pawnDefensive2: Seeking safety. That is your weakness.
psychology.pawnDefensive3: Cautious move, but already too late.
psychology.aggressive1: Aggressive strategy. But I've calculated all possibilities.
psychology.aggressive3: Preparing an attack. Countermeasures are already prepared.
psychology.defensive1: Focusing on defense. But that's the trap.
psychology.defensive2: Prudent choice. But already too late.
psychology.defensive4: I've already calculated your next move.
psychology.quickMove1: That hasty decision... Within expected range.
psychology.quickMove2: An instant judgment. But already calculated.
psychology.quickMove3: Quick decision-making. But that is your weakness.
psychology.longThink1: After all that thinking... Was that all?
psychology.longThink2: That was your conclusion after all that time?
psychology.longThink3: You spent so much time, but it was still an expected move.
psychology.hesitation1: You hesitated so much. Can't make up your mind?
psychology.hesitation2: I see hesitation. Are you uncertain?
psychology.hesitation3: I saw you picking up and putting down pieces. Are you anxious?
psychology.longHesitation1: After all that thinking and hesitation... Was that all?
psychology.longHesitation2: You spent so much time and hesitated so much, but it was still an expected move.
psychology.longHesitation3: That was your conclusion after all that hesitation?
psychology.normalMove1: A measured decision. Within expected range.
psychology.normalMove2: A balanced move. But I've already calculated it.
psychology.normalMove3: You took your time, but it was still predictable.

errors.threefoldRepetition: Threefold repetition rule: The same board state cannot be repeated 3 times.

gameRoom.confirmLeave: Game in progress. Are you sure you want to return to the lobby?
gameRoom.confirmLeaveSubtext: Your current game will not be saved.

tutorial.title: TUTORIAL // SYSTEM TRAINING

goal.title: Game Objective
goal.description: A strategic game on a 5x5 board against AI. Win by capturing the enemy king or moving your king to the opponent's end (top row).

pieces.title: Piece Types
pieces.description:
Each side has 5 pieces:
‚Ä¢ King (K): The most important piece. If captured, you lose.
‚Ä¢ Knight (N): Moves in an L-shape.
‚Ä¢ Pawn (P): Moves forward only, attacks diagonally.

king.title: King Movement
king.description: The king can move one square in any direction (up, down, left, right, or diagonally). Win by moving your king to the opponent's end (top row)!

knight.title: Knight Movement
knight.description: The knight moves in an L-shape. It can jump over other pieces, making it strategically useful.

pawn.title: Pawn Movement
pawn.description: The pawn moves forward one square only. However, it can only attack diagonally.

victory.title: Victory Conditions
victory.description:
There are two ways to win:
1. Capture the enemy king
2. Move your king to the top row (row 0)

üìä 30-Turn Judgement:
‚Ä¢ At 30 turns, winner is determined by king advancement and material score
‚Ä¢ Closer to goal and more pieces = advantage
‚Ä¢ Draws are extremely rare

üîÑ Threefold Repetition Rule:
‚Ä¢ Moves that repeat the same board state 3 times are forbidden
‚Ä¢ Prevents repetitive strategies and maintains game tension

‚è±Ô∏è Time Limit:
‚Ä¢ Initial time: 180 seconds (3 minutes)
‚Ä¢ +5 seconds per move
‚Ä¢ Immediate defeat if time reaches 0
‚Ä¢ Same time limit applies to both sides

start.title: Starting the Game
start.description: Click a piece to select it, then click the square you want to move to. Valid move squares are highlighted in blue. You're now ready to face the AI!

tutorial.notAvailableDescription: The tutorial for this game is not yet available.

notFound.title: SECTOR NOT FOUND
notFound.message: The coordinates you specified do not exist in this system.

miniChess.name: Mini Chess
miniChess.description: Strategic game on 5x5 board against AI
